intro: Diplycosia heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf diplycosia, is a flowering plant species native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its variable leaf shapes, which can range from ovate to linear, depending on environmental conditions. It produces small white or pink flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. The species is often found in heathlands and open forests, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
